website_summaries.verdict: This Editors' Choice-winning bulb excelled in each one of our tests, and you can get it at a very reasonable price point. In our eyes, it's a best buy among BR30 LEDs.
pros: The GE Reveal BR30 LED offers superior color quality, a design that manages heat better than the competition, and exceptional performance on dimmer switches
cons: The uptick in color quality comes at a cost of efficiency -- the GE Reveal uses more watts than the competition to put out the same amount of light

customer_reviews.title: Be sure you only buy this model of GE Flood.
customer_reviews.text: LEDs are good in theory but often fall short in execution. I started replacing my incandescent floods in the kitchen as the burned out an all was well until I got to the fifth one... at that point, one started flickering... I had used a previous version of the GE bulb (it didn't have the blue ring around the base). After trying many things, I ended up replacing them with this model (83574) and the issue went away. I'm not sure why the earlier version is even still on the market, but these do fix the problem.
customer_reviews.author: J. King

customer_reviews.title: lightbulbs are failing after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought 8 of these for recessed lighting in our kitchen in August. It's November and 3 of the 8 lights have begun to flicker. By flicker, it literally turns on and sporadically turns on and off. Figured it couldn't be the lightbulbs this soon so had an electrician out to confirm it wasn't the light fixtures. Lo and behold, the fixtures are fine and the lightbulbs are failing. Hard to justify spending ~$20 per lightbulb especially with lifespan far less than as advertised. Can't return them at this point either. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Keane Jr

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed.  Never Again.
customer_reviews.text: Just a few months after purchase these bulbs started to flicker on and off periodically. Not enough to make me want to deal with the hassle of a return; but then, it happened more and more until one by one they stopped working alltogether. Absolute waste of money considering how much they cost and how these are supposed to last for years. Very disappointed. Very aggravated. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Don't even think about buying these
customer_reviews.text: I have a large 5,000 sq ft house about bought about 30 of these bulbs which cost a lot of money. Put them throughout the house. Within 6-12 months half of them started flickering. Trying moving them around, screwing them in tighter, etc but eventually had to replace them. It was too late to refund through Amazon so you have to go through a terrible process with GE and who wants a replacement anyway. No way to get a refund so you will be throwing your money down the drain with these.
customer_reviews.author: Customer99

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than a year...
customer_reviews.text: I love the Reveal light color and have used them for years before LED's. This last one of these I replaced lasted 11 months. But, in fact, I've noticed NO brands of these LED last any longer than the incandescent. The government was "sold a bill of goods" in the name of the environment. Consumers are now charged more and there will be more in the landfills. Very disappointing. I hope the manufacturers figure out how to truly make a LED to last more than a year.
customer_reviews.author: Susan H. Easterday

customer_reviews.title: Good bulbs to replace halogen PAR 30
customer_reviews.text: Used these to replace the halogen bulbs in my office. They give better color than the halogen did. And they seem brighter too, maybe because of the color temp. Very good bulbs. I measured the light on my desk with a light meter and it is exactly the same as before. They do dim but even with the dimmer fully down they are still on and a little too bright. This is not a problem in my office but it might be in other rooms. And when the dimmer is engaged they do flicker, not to much but still a problem. They are ok for flicker at around 50% output.
customer_reviews.author: W. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: most fail within a year or two
customer_reviews.text: Bought a number of these over a two year period - over half of them have failed within 12-24 months. they start to blink on and off and then go dark. technically under warranty, but must ship back to GE at customer's expense. poor product and even worse customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Mark R Cordes

customer_reviews.title: love the light - but have had 2 now 3 of 6 fail within weeks of each other.
customer_reviews.text: love the light - but have had 2 of 6 start flickering after a year of use. Am seeking replacements from GE under warranty. Updated just have a 3rd fail 2 weeks later. reduced to 2 stars. I've had halogens in the same room running for about 5 years now without a single failure. We'll see how responsive GE is... This was a $15 bulb at the time of purchase, 2/16.
customer_reviews.author: DAL

customer_reviews.title: Beware: Defective, Short Lifespan
customer_reviews.text: Updated Review: These were great while they worked, but sadly I have had multiple fail on me within the first year. First they start to flicker, then they die altogether. Steer clear of them, the light quality is fantastic but the build quality is garbage. Original Review: The light quality of these is excellent! After installing 11 new can lights with these bulbs and with Lutron Caseta dimmers I am now planning on switching over the rest of my entire house. Way better than the CFL can lights I previously had.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Brown

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible, Horrible, Horrible. I bought 40 of these to replace lights in my home and not a single one lasted more than a week before blinking and ultimately failing. I thought maybe the "smart" bulbs weren't working in my older home so I took them to a brand new mountain house. Same problem. It's baffling to me that GE could put out such a crappy product. $900 down the drain. I will never buy another GE product again.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Rea

customer_reviews.title: Great light, may have a small failure rate
customer_reviews.text: I like the light these bulbs give off. Very bright and clean (not harsh). Only problem i've had is that they have a failure rate apparently. I've purchased over 30 for my entire home and had 3 go out already (in less than a year). I was able to replace or refund them but I hope the remaining bulbs will last for the long run.
customer_reviews.author: captainamerica

customer_reviews.title: Sad because I really liked the light of the original ...
customer_reviews.text: 1st, they die within two years. 2nd, GE changed the design and now the new Reveal light bulbs are pink, PINK!, with pink light. Other brands now offer color enhancing light bulbs and are getting promising reviews. Saving up to replace all of my expensive Reveal bulbs with another brand. Sad because I really liked the light of the original bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Buy anything else
customer_reviews.text: These have to be in the running for the worst LED flood bulbs ever. We bought about 6 of them originally, and have had to return and replace at least 6 bulbs. They work fine for a while (short while) and then start turning off and on randomly until you go crazy. I don't know if GE has fixed the problem, but it appears to be a common issue with these bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Tanner D Rousselle

customer_reviews.title: I bought 15 of these 11 months ago. 8 ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought 15 of these 11 months ago. 8 of them have burned out so far.. most in the past 2 months. They certainly don't last close to 10 years as advertised!
customer_reviews.author: David Lee

customer_reviews.title: Fails too soon
customer_reviews.text: The color and brightness are great, but when you spend $15 for an LED bulb you expect it to last more than 6 months. I have 4 in my kitchen and one is already flickering in and out. Any energy savings from having an LED is lost from having to replace said LED.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: 4 out of 15 purchased bulbs fail after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: We purchased 15 LED bulbs in December of 2015. They all operated fine for six months and then over the past few months, we have had four failures. The replacement incadescent bulbs are working fine. We were initially excited by these bulbs as they provide a much warmer light than the more white light LED bulbs that we have in other parts of the house. I will be testing out the return policy on these bulbs and will post the outcome.
customer_reviews.author: Kautilya1

customer_reviews.title: At least 30% failure rate.  Stay away.
customer_reviews.text: At least 30% failure rate. Stay away. I bought 20 of these units at considerable expense. 4 have failed within 6 months. Blinking. Not the advertised 15 years.
customer_reviews.author: Big Al Jackson

customer_reviews.title: These bulbs flicker and then die in year or so ...
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs flicker and then die in year or so. Warranty says 10 years but you have mail the bulb to GE for a replacement. Very unsatisfied with this item.
customer_reviews.author: October Hill

customer_reviews.title: I use this for my front porch light which is ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my front porch light which is mounted 14feet high. It's on a dimmer and has been on for 2.5 years so far.
customer_reviews.author: Rex Diamond

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 18 months for a Product advertised to last 22 years
customer_reviews.text: Is it possible to give 0 stars to a product advertised to last 22 years but last 18 months? I am communicating with GE now...hopefully I will have a better experience than the rest of the reviewers here.
customer_reviews.author: david l brooks

customer_reviews.title: Stay away. It's a Lemon
customer_reviews.text: Horrible!! 4 out of 12 have failed in 6 months. GE won't replace without it costing you time and your own money.
customer_reviews.author: KBC

customer_reviews.title: The flickering bulb is reported by 11%. I want ...
customer_reviews.text: The flickering bulb is reported by 11%. I want to keep the percentage honest because my bulb flickered... Maybe I'll try again in 5 years, hoping they get their act together.
customer_reviews.author: Quantum326

customer_reviews.title: Two failed out of six within a month.
customer_reviews.text: I have had the same experience as others have noted with these bulbs with two of six failing within a month. The first start to flicker on and off and then stop functioning altogether. They're indoors and not on a dimmer - not that either of those should be an issue but just to point out they're in a simple installation. Not very pleased with the quality of these bulbs. Those that remain in operation do provide a pleasant and diffuse light.
customer_reviews.author: Eva M.

customer_reviews.title: Based on the other poor reviews, seems like I'm not the only one ...
customer_reviews.text: Less than 2 years ago, I bought 16 of these for my basement. One is already starting to flicker and go out. Based on the other poor reviews, seems like I'm not the only one having trouble. Aren't these supposed to last a long time?
customer_reviews.author: Matt S

customer_reviews.title: Though this bulb is represented as an LED equivalent to ...
customer_reviews.text: Though this bulb is represented as an LED equivalent to a 65W incandescent BR30 spotlight bulb, in a side-by-side comparison, the output of this bulb is extremely dim and the wide beam angle is not even close to being a "spotlight."
customer_reviews.author: Corsa140

customer_reviews.title: Only 50% of our purchased LED reveal lights have worked so far! :(
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased 6 of the LED BR30 lights and 3 have stopped working within a few months. The lights basically start blinking on and off, sort of a flicker. We always used the regular BR30 Reveal lights and we loved them so we were excited to find out that they made an LED version. Unfortunately, they just haven't been up to the standard I would expect from GE and the Reveal line of light bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany N

customer_reviews.title: Dont last
customer_reviews.text: I bought several and about half started blinking within a few weeks. One went completely out after 10 months (rarely used in spare bathroom). I would like to send it back if under warranty still.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Simoneau

customer_reviews.title: flashing bulb
customer_reviews.text: I have been purchasing these light bulbs for some time and never had a problem until now. It seems to be this last batch that has the defective bulbs. I have removed every one of them and kept them to return. Finally the third one is flashing now too! I don't know if these have been manufactured in a new facility with bad quality control or what the issue is. Please help!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: I replaced traditional bulbs with LED in an attempt to ...
customer_reviews.text: I replaced traditional bulbs with LED in an attempt to avoid regular bulb replacement. Sadly, after about a year, some started flickering.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Defective product, do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product. The bulbs are defective and start to flicker after a couple of months. I splurged and got these for an 2 story entryway, hoping I wouldn't have to replace them for at least 5+ years. No such luck and I'll never buy GE LED bulbs again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Failed in less than 1 year
customer_reviews.text: It was a good bulb while it lasted. Turned on quickly, worked silently and gave good light. However, failed in less than one year with at most moderate use.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest R.

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Burned out in less than 6 months! Don't waste your money. Updated. GE gave me a coupon for another one. I used it. Piece of garbage burned out too after several months. I won't be using this anymore even if they give them to me for free.
customer_reviews.author: Chris T Bartz

customer_reviews.title: Multiple bulbs have failed during use.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 6 bulbs for use in kitchen. One began to flicker and another failed completely within a few years of use.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Quality Issues
customer_reviews.text: Bought about 6 of these and one of them is already blinking after only 2 months of use. The price was great but I'm not so sure about the quality.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonFL

customer_reviews.title: I bought 7 of these in January and three of ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought 7 of these in January and three of them have started blinking on and off when switched on."Lasts 22.8 years based on 3 hours per day usage" according to the description. I thought I wouldn't have to mess with replacing these bulbs EVER.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: great lighting
customer_reviews.text: great lighting - not too harsh and oh, so bright! i wonder how i survived using my countertop in the kitchen so long with such dull lighting before!! well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: J McGrawTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: GE = Good Enough
customer_reviews.text: These are good light bulbs with good quality of light tone. The price could be better but the manufacturers control pricing for next generation of light bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Yodes

customer_reviews.title: Too cool
customer_reviews.text: Tried to integrate with existing GE incandescents in the kitchen. Says it's 2700k soft white (I double and triple checked to make sure I had gotten the right one), but it is a much cooler white than any of the incandescent I was trying to blend it with. I had better luck with a Feit Enhance LED.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Replaced all my recessed bulbs with these. Absolutely no complaints so far.
customer_reviews.author: VTENGR

customer_reviews.title: Pricey Good Bulbs
customer_reviews.text: These are great bulbs, but, the price is too high.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Randall

customer_reviews.title: Does not last! 3 of 3 have failed in 4 months
customer_reviews.text: My contractor bought two of these and we liked them so well we bought a third for over the sink. They have ALL started flickering after just 4 months. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Halloran

customer_reviews.title: I will send the bad light bulb back to GE
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of these light bulbs. One of them started flickering at 3 months. I will send the bad light bulb back to GE. So far this is a 25% failure rate. I will report back if more lightbulbs fail.
customer_reviews.author: A. N.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't dim all the way....
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good, lots of nice white light. My only gripe us it doesn't dim to a low light: still too bright on full dim
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great in my recessed ceiling light. You can't even tell it is not an incandescent.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Almost 50% burned out or started flickering after a couple months. No warranty and cannot return to Amazon. Would not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Wrangler1980

customer_reviews.title: I have had GE Reveal incandescent bulbs that I really liked, but the color of these LED bulbs is ...
customer_reviews.text: These light bulbs make the room look purple. I have had GE Reveal incandescent bulbs that I really liked, but the color of these LED bulbs is very unpleasant.
customer_reviews.author: LSFromKY

customer_reviews.title: I really appreciate that the light is instant with no warm up period & the quality of light is great.
customer_reviews.text: Used it to replace CFL's in the kitchen. I really appreciate that the light is instant with no warm up period & the quality of light is great.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny G.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent overall; limited "dimability"
customer_reviews.text: Excellent in almost all respects, particularly color; but lowest dimmed setting is somewhat too bright.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Poltun

customer_reviews.title: Perfect color, low power use, but at least 10% failure rate in under 9 months
customer_reviews.text: I started buying these in April with an order of 20, for replacing all the recessed flood lights to LED in our home. I had one bulb go bad in about 4 months but I kept buying, completing our number to 55 by October. Unfortunately, since October I had 4 more failures, so it is 5 out of 45 installed bulbs that failed in about 9 months. None of these are on dimmers so it really seems like a legitimate quality issue.
customer_reviews.author: Soner

customer_reviews.title: Just like the other reviews
customer_reviews.text: 7 or 8 months later....flickered a few times them failed. Just like the other reviews.
customer_reviews.author: ACW

customer_reviews.title: Buy the best, GE Reveal LED lights are the best!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 5 LED lights from different manufactures and this is the one I found most appealing to my eyes. There were a few brighter options but the color looked sterile and I felt like I was in a doctors office.
customer_reviews.author: Trent

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Instant on to full brightness. White light. Dim able with no buzz.
customer_reviews.author: R. T.

customer_reviews.title: you won't like these. They are not the same color rendering
customer_reviews.text: If you're a fan of the incandescent version of the GE Reveal bulbs, you won't like these. They are not the same color rendering, much whiter.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Heinen

customer_reviews.title: Overheats and quits working.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 6 of these bulbs. After a few months of use (averaging about an hour a day) one of the bullbs now blinks on and off for a few minutes and then stops working altogether until it cools down. Unacceptable for such an expensive item.
customer_reviews.author: Fredmo

product_meta.title: GE Lighting 83574 Reveal LED 12-Watt (65-watt Replacement), 650-Lumen BR30 Spotlight Bulb with Medium Base, Reveal, 1-Pack
product_meta.description: GE reveal LED bulbs fill your home with clean, beautiful light and make colors and patterns pop. These bulbs' funnel shape and reflective coating help direct light where it is needed better than a standard incandescent bulb.
feature_bullets: Lasts 22.8 years based on 3 hours per day usage
Estimated yearly energy costs $1.45 based on 3 hours per day $0.11 per kWh
GE reveal LED bulbs illuminate your environment with a color enhanced light spectrum

specifications.Customer Reviews: 2.6 out of 5 stars96 ratings2.6 out of 5 stars
